sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider a graph with 7 vertices as shown below. Find a Hamiltonian cycle in this graph.

```
   1-----2
  /       \
 6         3
  \       /
   5-----4
``` 

(Note: A Hamiltonian cycle is a cycle that visits each vertex exactly once.)
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle in the given graph is:

1 - 2 - 3 - 4 - 5 - 6 - 1

This cycle visits each vertex exactly once and returns to the starting vertex, satisfying the conditions of a Hamiltonian cycle.
